page.title: 01GENERAL BACKGROUND
page.content: {FARMING}has been the dominant feature of this part of Central Essex for many centuries.The{SOIL}is heavy clay but fertile and currently specializes in{ {ARABLE}cultiviation.Land is expensive, as much as Â£2,800.00 an acre.{GREEN {BELT}policies restrict new building. {POPULATION}is small and centres on 3 hamlets. Many are now affluent commu- ters. Only one{MAJOR ROAD}crosses this area,the A414 linking Chelmsford with Ongar. Other roads are fairly quiet country lanes. There are few{EMPLOY- {MENT}opportunities here,local farmers employ only a handful of skilled men. {COMMUNITY LIFE}centres on a chapel and 3 pubs.{FACILITIES}are inadequate for those without their own transport. The siting of the 3rd London Airport at Stansted and easy access to trunk roads will put more pressure on the Ecology and existing Social Structure.
